A059E1B390C34DF7934C163D6B57D5B4.description: In addition, students can bring well-developed and well-founded reasoned arguments about how different choices of technical solutions may have different consequences for the individual, society and environment.

AC720D728BCB44F8A5474E5894D35423.description: Students may bring a well-developed and well-informed discussion on how objects and technical systems in society change over time and then show the drivers of technology development.

E202C90D73DE48118BA588776C21681E.description: Pupils make well-developed documentation of work with sketches, models, drawings or reports where the intent of work is well visible.

241FD9D28BE24D83B4ABDAACDD8ECC51.description: During the work process the student can formulate and may choose options that lead forward.

61A8C25B5EA24138A47CECBE6F7B84C5.description: Pupils can carry out simple technology development and design work by examining and systematically examining and reviewing possible ideas for solutions and formulate well-developed and elaborate physical or digital models.

E4B7C784C45D46579059C4B5ED932AB2.description: In addition to this the student develops an informed discussion about the similarities and differences between some materials and their use of technical solutions.

4CBF4129E6ED4E9894D0EED09D3F86F2.description: Pupils can explore the different technologies in everyday life and with good use of subject-specific concepts describe how the components interact to achieve efficiency and function and show other similar solutions.

C6B47DA7AB7A41BA93D6FD4E58222F63.description: In addition, the student has  well-developed and well founded discussions on how humans use  energy and natural resources, environmental impact and displays various perspectives on the benefits and limitations of some measures that can contribute to sustainable development.

F0F4E2C616AA406BA1028B77A83D0DFC.description: Students investigate how some chemicals and chemical processes are used in everyday life and society and describe the complex relationships and explain and generalize about energy transformations and cycles of matter.

F9F415029F654D5F9F93943A40B9CDBA.description: Students can have well-developed and well-founded reasoning about chemical processes in living organisms, soil, air and water and shows the complex chemical relationships in nature.

AD51AB19B84D48BE988600DD4BFF236B.description:
The students have very good knowledge of the structure, conservation and
conversions of matter and its relation to other chemical context and shows by explaining and demonstrating the context and any general characteristic with good use of chemistry concepts, models and theories.

C18C6A305A894306833FCECEEACA4DA3.description: In addition, the student is able to form well-elaborated and well-informed discussion on the impact of human nature and show different perspectives on the advantages and limitations of any action that may contribute to ecologically sustainable development.

66B36CF0D7B447799CA7689D936E661D.description: The student investigates various factors on ecosystems and populations, and describes the complex ecological context and explains and generalizes about energy flows and cycles.

078E5C97EA3643F29E8C8EE8DC236F4F.description: The student is able to form well-elaborated and an informed discussion about health, illness, sexuality and inheritance, and then displays the complex relationships related to the human body and its functions.

F3A3E6AEC0044522A5CCE336693D6FD5.description: The student has very good knowledge of the theory of evolution and other biological context and shows that by explaining and demonstrating the connection of these and some general feature of good use of biological concepts, models and theories.

8F7ECBBED61C40D186F87336C8D3B363.description: In addition the student makes well developed and reasoned, arguments about how humans and technology impacts on the environmental and shows from various perspectives the benefits and limitations of some measures that can contribute to sustainable development.

D17BFB5FCEC240FEBC64C0EC7DDE40AD.description: Pupils use physical models in a very effective way to explain and generalise particles and radiation.

5251CF60F51F457584088AAE06022145.description: Students may make well developed and well founded reasoning, for the phenomena of everyday life and society, coupled with forces, motion, levers, lights, sound and electricity, and show the complex physical relations.

F02C01DF5D554DC6A79A8D39D89C414C.description: Pupils have a very good knowledge of energy, matter, structure of the universe and its development, and other physical contexts, showing it by explaining and showing connections, with some general features, with good use of physics concepts, models and theories.

D4A93086ECF8426296069590203E1B30.description: Pupils can explain and generalise some key scientific discoveries and their significance to human living conditions.

7E2DEB010674464A899594D134B7CC28.description: In addition, a student produces well developed documentation of the study with charts, graphs, pictures and written reports.

1B18648DEE8B412F81DDB358F86EBE10.description: Pupils make well-developed discussions of the results reasonableness in relation to possible sources of error, offers suggestions on how investigations may improve and point to new potential issues to consider.

938C03AAD9DD496A920B6209060BF394.description: Pupils can compare results with questions and draw conclusions developed with good reference to physical models and theories.

742FFD7421174BFC8E2095DCB43D19F9.description: During the studies pupils use the equipment safely, efficiently and effectively.

4B314C252ED947DFB2A601F797E73730.description: Pupils can carry out studies based on given plans and also formulate simple issues and plans that make it possible to work systematically.

2FBDF024D26944548E6B2E71061EDA26.description: Pupils can use the information in an efficient manner in discussions and to create well-developed texts and other representations with good adaptation to purpose and audience.

45BC5DE652C7492BA5FC12363B6BAF0B.description:
Students may seek scientific information and will use various sources to make well developed and well founded reasoning about information and a sources 
credibility and relevance.

8079B7AEAB6542BFA6499187318AED1F.description: The student asks questions, expresses opinions and responds in a way that discussions can move forward, deepening or widening them.

9DC2335DCBAA4A88B43C91E44171B2C2.description: Pupils can talk about and discuss issues related to energy, technology, environment and society with different facts and values, ​​and formulates and develops justified positions, describing some of the possible consequences
